H0.text: Energy is released more by aerobic respiration than by anaerobic respiration.

H1.text: Heat is released more by aerobic respiration when compared to anaerobic respiration.

H2.text: Carbon dioxide is released in greater amounts during aerobic respiration than during anaerobic respiration.

H3.text: Pressure is released more by aerobic respiration when compared to anaerobic respiration.

A4.text: Fermentation is less efficient at using the energy from glucose: only 2 ATP are produced per glucose, compared to the 38 ATP per glucose nominally produced by aerobic respiration.
